SEARCH
Package server

Class RequestParser.RequestInfo

java.lang.Object
server.RequestParser.RequestInfo
Enclosing class:
RequestParser
public static class RequestParser.RequestInfo extends Object
RequestInfo is an immutable data class that encapsulates all components of a parsed HTTP request. This inner class provides structured access to request data including the HTTP method, URI, path segments, parameters, and request body content.

Instances of this class are created by the RequestParser.parseRequest() method and provide read-only access to the parsed request components through getter methods.

Example usage:

 
 RequestInfo info = RequestParser.parseRequest(reader);
 String method = info.getHttpCommand();        // "GET", "POST", etc.
 String fullUri = info.getUri();               // "/api/users?id=123"
 String[] pathSegments = info.getUriSegments(); // ["api", "users"]
 Map<String, String> params = info.getParameters(); // {id: "123"}
 byte[] body = info.getContent();              // Request body as bytes
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Almog Sharoni Yuval Harary

  • Constructor Details

    • RequestInfo

      public RequestInfo(String httpCommand, String uri, String[] uriSegments, Map<String,String> parameters, byte[] content)
      Constructs a new RequestInfo with the specified request components. This constructor creates an immutable request information object with all the parsed components of an HTTP request.
      Parameters:
      httpCommand - the HTTP method (e.g., "GET", "POST", "DELETE")
      uri - the complete URI including any query parameters
      uriSegments - the URI path split into individual segments
      parameters - a map of parsed query parameters and form data
      content - the request body content as a byte array

  • Method Details

    • getHttpCommand

      public String getHttpCommand()
      Returns the HTTP method/command for this request.
      Returns:
      the HTTP method as a string (e.g., "GET", "POST", "DELETE")

    • getUri

      public String getUri()
      Returns the complete URI for this request. This includes the path and any query parameters.
      Returns:
      the complete URI string (e.g., "/api/users?id=123")

    • getUriSegments

      public String[] getUriSegments()
      Returns the URI path segments for routing purposes. The URI path is split into individual segments with empty segments removed.
      Returns:
      an array of URI path segments (e.g., ["api", "users"] for "/api/users")

    • getParameters

      public Map<String,String> getParameters()
      Returns the parsed request parameters. This includes both query parameters from the URI and form data from POST requests.
      Returns:
      a Map containing parameter names as keys and their values as strings

    • getContent

      public byte[] getContent()
      Returns the request body content as raw bytes. For GET requests, this is typically an empty byte array. For POST requests, this contains the request body data.
      Returns:
      the request body content as a byte array
